name: CSR Europe, The Business Network for Corporate Social Responsibility
goal: CSR Europe is the leading European business network for corporate social responsibility (CSR) with around 50 multinational member companies and 40 national partner organisations in 33 countries across Europe and in other regions, reaching out to more than 10000 companies worldwide. CSR Europe acts as the European platform for companies and their stakeholders to exchange and cooperate to make themselves and Europe global leaders in sustainable competitiveness and societal wellbeing. The network was established in 1995 by senior European business leaders in response to an appeal by the European Commission President Jacques Delors.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: SDGs implementation and engagement in the Multi-stakeholder Platform on the implementation of the SDGs in an EU context, Future of Work, Apprenticeships , Non-Financial Reporting Directive, Tax transparency and CbCR, European Alliance on Apprenticeships, Digital Jobs, European Partnership on Active and Healthy Ageing, Circular Economy, Resource-efficient Europe, Responsible supply chain, entrepreneurship, business and human rights, sectors.
